etymology.description: Depicts a mortar, often used with a pestle in the ancient form of 舂(舂) (chōng, "pound grain")
etymology.interpretation: The character 臼(臼) (jiù, "mortar") is an ancient pictogram representing a mortar used for grinding, commonly seen in traditional processes such as grain pounding, as depicted in the related character 舂(舂) (chōng, "pound grain"). Its form visually represents the receptacle used to process grains.

examples.chinese: 他用一臼轻轻拂去脸上的尘土(他用一臼輕輕拂去臉上的塵土)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng yī jiù qīngqīng fú qù liǎn shàng de chéntǔ.
examples.english: He used his pair of hands to gently brush away the dust on his face.

examples.chinese: 运动员凭借一臼快速接过球(運動員憑借一臼快速接過球)。
examples.pinyin: Yùndòngyuán píngjiè yī jiù kuàisù jiē guò qiú.
examples.english: The athlete quickly caught the ball with his pair of hands.
